Resize an image to fit to the new maximum dimensions with a high quality, bilinear processing
The new maximum width The new maximum height
Input images which are smaller than the maximum dimensions won't generally get more large. Widths or heights with zero value will be ignored for size calculation
[adminsupport] 11.11.2004 Created
Resize an image to fit to the new maximum dimensions
The new maximum width The new maximum height Fit or scale the image
Input images which are smaller than the maximum dimensions won't generally get more large. Widths or heights with zero value will be ignored for size calculation
[adminsupport] 11.11.2004 Created
Image scaling modes
[adminsupport] 19.03.2005 Created
The image will be resized with width and height values as maximum values
Requires at least one value of width and height; zero values lead to ignoration when calculating new size Width respectively height might change its value to reflect the new size information. See CurrentWidth and CurrentHeight for updated values
[adminsupport] 19.03.2005 Created
The image will be resized to fill the complete area defined by width and height
Requires width and height value, otherwise an exception will be thrown
[adminsupport] 19.03.2005 Created
The image will be resized and centered to be completely inside of width and height, empty areas will be filled with the background color
Requires width and height value, otherwise an exception will be thrown
[adminsupport] 19.03.2005 Created
The image will be resized with width and height values as maximum values, but only if the result is smaller. That means a larger image will be resized to a smaller size, but a smaller image will not be enlarged.
Requires at least one value of width and height; zero values lead to ignoration when calculating new size Width respectively height might change its value to reflect the new size information. See CurrentWidth and CurrentHeight for updated values
[baldauf] 03.07.2010 Created
